How it works
>assuming you one 1 (one) Bitcoin
>on the first record date, for example Jan 1, the price is 70 000 EUR
>on the next record date (Jan 1 the following year) the price is 100 000 EUR
>You now owe 10 800 EUR in taxes even if you did not sell it
>the tax does not have to be paid immediately but with the next tax assessment (usually April or May the following year)
>If the price of Bitcoin falls between the second record date and the date of the tax assessment back to 70 000 EUR or even below THE FULL 10 800 EUR ARE STILL OWED

item.title: /XMR/ Monero General (240 replies)
item.description:
Welcome to /XMR/ Monero General, dedicated to the discussion of the world's most widely adopted privacy coin.

XMR payments are anonymous, low-fee, and fully fungible. Users can send and receive XMR globally without having to worry about tainted coins. Battle-tested privacy tech (Ring Signatures, Stealth Addresses and RingCT) ensures that critical TX data cannot be gleaned from the Monero blockchain; the TX history of all XMR users is kept hidden, with TXs being optionally transparent via the aid of a view key.

XMR ensures low TX fees by employing a dynamic block size that can "stretch" to easily accommodate sudden TX spikes.

XMR's mining algorithm, RandomX, is optimized for devices using general-purpose CPUs e.g. desktops, laptops, smartphones, tablets, keeping the barrier to entry low and ASICs out of the equation.

XMR's tail emission - 0.6 XMR per block forever - incentivizes for-profit miners to keep mining, helping boost long-term network security. This constant linear inflation trends to zero and is offset by coin loss.

XMR has proven to be the only altcoin capable of overcoming BTC's network effect by driving it out of the darknet economy BTC dominated for over 10 years. XMR is also starting to overtake BTC in clearnet commerce as well.

If you still have questions, feel free to ask. A MoneroChad will be with you shortly.

XMR Redpill: https://youtube.com/watch?v=wq6w03E2DS4

BUY XMR: https://monero.eco/exchanges/
Crypto ATMs: https://coinatmradar.com/

XMR Resources: https://monero.observer/resources/

XMR Stats: https://moneroj.net

USE XMR: https://cryptwerk.com/pay-with/xmr/

https://www.getmonero.org/get-started/mining/

item.title: I'm here to tell you the truth about Bitcoin. If you do (123 replies)
item.description:
I'm here to tell you the truth about Bitcoin. If you don't want to listen, that's fine by me.

Bitcoin is an amazing invention that should go down in our history textbooks, but only time will tell if this becomes the case.

Bitcoin showed the world that we really don't need a trusted third party to do all the things we thought we needed them to do. Make no mistake, we still need trusted third parties, and we will probably never fully eliminate them. The government isn't going away and neither are banks, however their role in our use of money will be diminished in the coming decades. Bitcoin does not "waste energy" it reallocates it to protecting its chain..The Proof-of-Work algorithm is still the only one that can guarantee it is prohibitively expensive to attack the network.

Some of you idiots have become convinced that Epstein created Bitcoin or some other ridiculous shit. Not only is that not true, even if it was true it would change nothing. Imagine a tweaking homeless man walks up to you on the street and then shits his pants right in front of you. He then reaches into his pants and, using his feces, writes down the solution to the Riemann Hypothesis on the floor. So you're the person that would say: "this solution is stupid and wrong because it came from him!" That's what an idiot would say.

Bitcoin could go to $0 tomorrow (it won't, trust me) and it still wouldn't change anything. Bitcoin has already begun to change the world and this new revolution in money will not stop for you or me or anybody else. Bitcoin is truly an amazing invention. Flawed in a lot of ways, but amazing and beautiful.

You cannot close Pandora's Box.

item.title: Understand the funeral industry. Prevent yourself from being ripped off. (117 replies)
item.description:
Basically, people are f'd up when going through grief, and in the West, especially for christians or traditiinalists, the traditional funeral service at a venue seems to be an iconic image.

Funeral Homes can be owned by corporations or private equity, who can be greedy people. They know the bereaved are in a lost and confused state of mind, and may not do research, "shop around" (seen as rude..), or understand the value for what they get.

Urns, Caskets, cremations, and services can be marked up several times over, with sales pressures like "this is the last thing you can do for mom" or.. "she would want this..", or the time pressure of funerals being held soon especially if you want to view the body (some say this is more painful).

It's too much to explain, but essentially, yes, investors are present in this industry, there is a massive lack of education on your consumer rights and knowledge (you can bring any third party casket or urn (costco, amazon lol)). Funeral Consumers Alliance is an american website that covers your rights in the US, and Canada is somewhat similar as well.

This industry is hard on its workers, it's not the best, and management want their margins for the rest of the company... or- even an independent or family owned home - who are mostly reasonable, caring, and personal, but can also be more profit than client motivated.

The following link is my full spiel with URLs and more stuff.

Help spread this around if you can, and keep it in mind for the future.

Let's not get ripped off.

Do a little shopping around, try to look for independant homes and question what you actually want. Ashes? An urn in an item actualky meaningful to that person?
A meaningful at home gathering (after some time has passed). Is a funeral home venue really needed? What is actualky the best way for everyone to interact and share?...

https://rentry.co/vykvsq95
